text.tspan: When confronted by an enemy, the Blattas
make the wise decision of standing down and
avoiding contact if they are fully aware that
their opponent is more powerful, has access to
more weapons, and has a larger army. The
ability to read the war situation on a small
battlefield is exceptional. Member sacrifices
are uncommon even if the battle situation
becomes unfavorable.
Blattas was an improvised group with little
combat power. The strategy is based on
surprise attacks on survivors, which they
rarely fight against trained groups. The
weapons are pre-war firearms, and their
fighting ability is even lower because they
did not distribute them to all personnel
due to a lack of weapons.
Most orphans follow Lahar because his command is remarkably good, but if his
order goes a little wrong, the irritable orphans will soon rebel against him. Most
of them are teenage boys and girls, and they are difficult to control because they
are impatient and do not consider the future.
The population was sustained by plunder without a resident.
Nonetheless, Blattas’ ability to grow to nearly 100 people was entirely
due to Lahar’s ability to pinpoint the location of each ‘water source.’
Lahar discovered that targeting and attacking the water source where
survivors came and went was more efficient than wandering through
the wilderness.
Based on his long treacherous
experience in the cave, he
learned how to conserve
supplies and survive in
confined spaces while also
learning to take the lives of
others to survive. Based on
these principles, he keeps a
small group together by
traveling back and forth in the
wilderness, stealing items from
the survivors, and distributing
them to his “family.”
Lahar had previously
lived in a small cave
with a group of
survivors. The
survivors in the cave
fought over limited
food, killing all but
Lahar and a few
children. Lahar
survived the nuclear
winter in a cave full of
corpses, then rose to
the surface with the
remaining children.
They discovered their
identity through the
cave’s totem and the
hieroglyphics written
on the wall.
Blattas is an orphan group that does everything
to survive. Blattas name derives from the
meaning of desert cockroach, and Lahar
genuinely believes that surviving in an
apocalyptic world is his only motivation.
In the early survivor
population, there was a
group of wandering orphans
during the post-war. The
children had no access to
food or water, nor did they
have access to small places
with water that did exist in
the wasteland. The majority
of them were doomed to die
in the desert or the grassland.
Then, a leader named Lahar
formed a group with the lost
children and called them
Blattas for them to live better
lives.
The Caballeros are willing to fight for
vengeance and their family. They have the will
to face any enemy, even if they go into the
battlefield bare-fisted. It would be a
considerable duty to face them head-on, even
for the empire.
People should not underestimate the
Caballeros’ fighting ability because they
stand together as apostles of justice and
are unafraid of entering the battlefield.
They only had the Fidelian Empire as an
enemy. Still, they regarded all groups other
than themselves as barbaric and needing
enlightenment.
They mostly live near crumbling
cathedrals or cemeteries (European-style
architecture) and travel on fast
motorcycles and cars decorated with
European knightly designs. Although
they use firearms as their primary
weapon, they are ready to use other
weapons if necessary.
The Caballeros organization values all of the
organization’s “symbolism.”Despite the post-war era’s
primary focus being firearm combat, they wear
anachronistic iron armor, which also serves as a barrier to
obtaining usable combat power.
Caballeros, who see themselves as the
only justice, have no intention of
establishing an equal relationship with
any other faction. They will lash out
mercilessly at those who attempt to do
so, even if it’s not the empire.
Caballeros also acts as a private security unit within their
reach. Their actions resemble the Japanese Yakuza, who
was close to local authorities or civilians in the pre-war
era. This does not imply that the Caballeros consider
others equally; instead, they accept their existence as
beings providing protection.
Caballeros is an anti-imperial army that
shows no hostility toward non-imperial
civilians. They have a special
relationship with the surrounding
groups of survivors. If the group is
protected by the Caballeros then the
Caballeros actively protects them from
the Fidelian Empire, desert marauders,
or looters swarming in the wilderness.
The Caballeros is an organization
led by a Spanish-American named
Morales Fiago; they are a post-
war organization that arose
immediately after the nuclear
winter. The empire refers to them
as gangsters, but they never refer
to themselves as such and
consider themselves the apostles
of mercy who enforce justice
against the unjust empire.
It’s a big drawback that replacing their troops
is almost impossible when they lose their
soldiers on the battlefield. This is because
Zaikasha consists of soldiers with exceptional
and unique individual abilities, primarily
trained when they were in the empire.
To put it bluntly, if even one casualty occurs in
Zaikasha, it leads to irreversible and
permanent weakening of the unit.
Zaikasha is a special unit built for missions
that require a high degree of
organizational combat power, such as
infiltrating enemy lines and assassinating
key figures. They have excellent combat
power as individuals, but when a whole
group of them unite to perform a mission,
their abilities are multiplied. Zaikasha is
the result of systematically operating
soldiers with strong individuals.
Rio is cautious of issuing orders because, although
Zaikasha has freedom of speech and can disagree
with Rio, they still obey “every” single order he gives.
This is a dangerous procedure because even if the
soldiers know their lives may be jeopardized, they
will still serve and follow Rio’s orders no matter
what.
They secure abandoned buildings in the desert as shelters
and negotiate with other groups to gain more resources. All
policies, such as food procurement, shelter security, and
resource supply, are carried out by a detailed military-style
plan. To secure resources, they sometimes do things similar
to mercenaries.
Rio took overall command of
the organization because
most of Zaikasha were
members of Officer Rio’s
direct unit who followed
after witnessing his charisma.
Rio, of course, can’t decide
everything on his own, so the
units under his command are
divided into few platoons to
separate his workloads.
However, Jake’s policy of running the empire was far from what
Rio had envisioned. He led his loyal followers to flee the empire
and form the Resistance.
This anti-imperial organization
founded by Rio Crassus, a Fidelian
Empire officer. Rio is a young soldier
who rose to prominence during the
empire’s early days. He efficiently led
his subordinates with excellent
tactical command and strategy and
contributed significantly to the
establishment of the empire.
The Zaikasha unit is one of the
empire’s elite units, and each
member has undergone rigorous
training to perform special
missions. All members are well-
trained soldiers, but they know
their respective roles because
they have experience with
unique missions in the group.
